paper_abstract: With the eye on defining a type-based semantics, this paper defines intersection and union type assignment for the sequent calculus chi, a substitution-free language that enjoys the Curry-Howard correspondence with respect to the implicative fragment of Gentzen's sequent calculus for classical logic. We investigate the minimal requirements for such a system to be complete (i.e. closed under redex expansion), and show that the non-logical nature of both intersection and union types disturbs the soundness (i.e. closed uder reduction) properties. This implies that this notion of intersection-union type assignment needs to be restricted to satisfy soundness as well, making it unsuitable to define a semantics. We will look at two (confluent) notions of reduction, called Call-by-Name and Call-by-Value, and prove soundness results for those.
paper_title: Completeness and Soundness Results for chi with Intersection and Union Types
